answers.answer: Yes, individuals can obtain temporary protection or asylum status in Romania. Your rights in Romania depend on your status and you can also apply for asylum within Romania, at a later point.

answers.answer: To obtain temporary protection as a person fleeing the war in Ukraine, one must meet certain criteria. First and foremost, you must be a Ukrainian citizen or have legally resided in Ukraine at the time the conflict began. Additionally, you should demonstrate that you face significant harm due to the ongoing armed conflict in Ukraine, either directly or indirectly. This can include threats to life, physical integrity, freedom, family rights, property, or other basic human rights. Furthermore, if applicable, you may also need to prove that you are unable to access international protection channels within Ukraine or outside it.
